Recently Added Words

Hello

/həˈloʊ/

exclamation, noun

Used as a greeting or to begin a phone conversation.

"Hello, how are you?"

Beginner

Goodbye

/ˌɡʊdˈbaɪ/

exclamation, noun

Used when leaving or ending a conversation.

"Goodbye, see you tomorrow!"

Beginner

Friend

/frɛnd/

noun

A person who you like and enjoy being with.

"She's my best friend."

Beginner

Delicious

/dɪˈlɪʃəs/

adjective

Having a very pleasant taste or smell.

"The cake was delicious."

Beginner

Acquire

/əˈkwaɪər/

verb

To come into possession or ownership of something.

"She acquired a taste for coffee after living in Italy."

Intermediate

Compromise

/ˈkɑːmprəmaɪz/

noun, verb

An agreement or settlement that is reached by both sides making concessions.

"They reached a compromise after hours of negotiation."

Vocabulary Learning Tips

Use Flashcards

Create physical or digital flashcards to review new words regularly.

Read Daily

Reading exposes you to vocabulary in context, which helps with retention.

Write Sentences

Practice using new words in your own sentences to reinforce learning.

Speak with Others

Use new vocabulary in conversation to improve recall and fluency.
